column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Mike Halterman : You 've been working at Y&R eleven years across two separate stints .
#Text=That kind of tenure in any job is a long time .
#Text=What made you stick with it as long as you have ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford : Because it 's fun !
#Text=Mike Halterman : Do you think Phyllis and Nicholas have a fighting chance , or will Phyllis be doomed to losing the men she loves , like with Danny and Jack ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford :
#Text=I think that it 's a soap opera and nobody ever stays happy for a long long time .
#Text=Mike Halterman : Phyllis had a lot of foils and enemies in the series , like Christine , Drucilla , and Diane .
#Text=Which one of those women do you think is Phyllis 's epic foil ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford : Christine by far .
#Text=She really really really gets under Phyllis ' skin .
#Text=The other two women are bad themselves , so they do n't get under her skin .
#Text=Mike Halterman : You 've won two Emmy Awards , both from separate and distinct parts in your story .
#Text=Out of the work which got you both Emmy Awards , which do you feel was your strongest body of work , the one you received on your first stint , or the one you got for your current stint ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford : Because the Emmys are judged by submitting two shows , I ca n't honestly answer that question .
#Text=The way Emmys are judged are on two shows from that year .
#Text=And you win if you have two strong shows , which is really luck .
#Text=A lot of luck , some talent , but a lot of luck .
#Text=You hope those two shows mix well together .
#Text=That 's luck too .
#Text=I had other years where I had more of a storyline written for me and did n't win .
#Text=So it 's really based on if you 're lucky enough to get two shows that really stand out .
#Text=Mike Halterman : Do you think Y&R should make more use of umbrella storylines , like the recent " Out of the Ashes " event ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford :
#Text=I 'm a big fan of character driven storylines .

#Text=That 's why I was a big fan of the Nick/Phyllis affair ; that was very much a character driven storyline and ratings really peaked at that time because everyone was interested in seeing the fallout .
#Text=I think that any actor on daytime is going to answer that question the same way .
#Text=Mike Halterman :
#Text=Some of your fans are new to the show , and others have watched since you first appeared in 1994 , and others have watched since the show first started .
#Text=What would you like to say as an end note to all of your fans ?
#Text=Michelle Stafford : Thank you for watching ! I hope we 've entertained you all .
#Text=When I watched the daytime shows when I was younger I used to be highly entertained .
#Text=I hope you 're as entertained as I was .
